SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.cip4.elk.alces.test
Class TestRunner

java.lang.Object
  org.cip4.elk.alces.test.TestRunner

public class TestRunner
extends java.lang.Object

This is the class in the Alces framework that is responsible for creating test sessions during which JMF messages are sent, received, and tested. Example usage:

  1. Create a TestRunner, TestRunner().
  2. Initialize the test environment init(). This starts a HTTP server, etc.
  3. Start a TestSession using one of the startTestSession*-methods.
  4. Any incoming messages that Alces can associate with the outgoing message that started a TestSession will automatically be associated with the TestSession. To receive events when an incoming message is received, register a listener with the TestSession using TestSession.addListener(TestSessionListener)
  5. When finished, destroy the test environment to release resources, destroy()

Version:
$Id$
Author:
Claes Buckwalter (clabu@itn.liu.se)

Constructor Detail

TestRunner

public TestRunner()
Default constructor that uses the TestSuite implemenation TestSuiteImpl.

TestRunner

public TestRunner(TestSuite testSuite)
Creates a new test environment for running tests. The TestSuite is the data model used to store all test data that is generated during the test sessions (TestSession).

Parameters:
testSuite - the TestSuite implementation to which all test data will generated by the TestRunner will be added
See Also:
TestSuite, TestSession

See Also:
startTestSession(File, String)

startTestSession

public TestSession startTestSession(OutMessage message,
                                    java.lang.String targetUrl)

startTestSession

public TestSession startTestSession(java.io.File testFile,
                                    java.lang.String targetUrl)
Starts a new test session using the specified file as the test session's initiating outgoing message. All outgoing messages sent and incoming messages received during a test session are tested by the Tests configured for this TestRunner. All outgoing messages are preprocessed by the Preprocessors configured for this TestRunner.

Parameters:
testFile - a file containing the message that starts the test session, for example a JMF message or a MIME package
targetUrl - the URL to send the outgoing message to
Returns:
the started test session

startTestSession

public TestSession startTestSession(OutMessage outMessage,
                                    java.io.File jdfFile,
                                    PreprocessorContext context,
                                    java.lang.String targetUrl)
Starts a TestSession based on the specified outgoing message.

Parameters:
outMessage - the outgoing message that starts the test session
jdfFile - the JDF file submitted by the message; null if no JDF file was submitted
context - the context used when preprocessing the message and the JDF file
targetUrl - the URL to send the outgoing message to
Returns:
the started test session

startTestSession

public TestSession startTestSession(OutMessage outMessage,
                                    java.io.File jdfFile,
                                    PreprocessorContext context,
                                    java.lang.String targetUrl,
                                    boolean asMime)
Starts a new TestSession by submitting a JDF file.

Parameters:
outMessage - the message used to submit the JDF file
jdfFile - the JDF file to submit
context - the preprocessing context
targetUrl - the URL to submit the JDF file to
asMime - true to package the JDF file, its content files, and the SubmitQueueEntry JMF message in a MIME package
Returns:

packageAsMime

public OutMessage packageAsMime(OutMessage outMessage,
                                java.io.File jdfFile)
Packages an the JMF message contained in outMessage, the JDF file, and all files referenced by the JDF file in a MIME package that is wrapped in an OutMessage.

Parameters:
outMessage - the JMF message to package together with the JDF file
jdfFile - the JDF file to package
Returns:
an OutMessage which body is the MIME package

init

public void init()
          throws java.lang.Exception
Initializes the test environment:
  • Creates and start HTTP server that listens for incoming messages
  • Creates a HTTP dispatcher for sending outgoing messages

Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the test session could not be initialized

sendMessage

public InMessage sendMessage(OutMessage message,
                             java.lang.String targetUrl)
                      throws java.io.IOException
Sends a OutMessage to the preconfigured target URL. The message is preprocessed before it is sent. If SenderIDPreprocessor is enabled then JMF/@SenderID will be replaced with the value configured SenderID.

Parameters:
message - the InMessage received in the response
Returns:
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an communication exception occurs during the message sending

startTestSessionWithSubmitQueueEntryWithHttpUrls

public TestSession startTestSessionWithSubmitQueueEntryWithHttpUrls(java.io.File jdfFile,
                                                                    java.lang.String targetUrl,
                                                                    boolean preprocessJdf)
Starts a new test session by resubmitting a JDF file. Any relative URLs in the JDF file will be resolved against the JDF file and replaced with http URLs.

Parameters:
jdfFile - the JDF file to submit
targetUrl - the URL to submit it to
preprocessJdf - true to preprocess the JDF file before submitting it; false otherwise
Returns:
the test session
See Also:
#startTestSessionWithResubmitQueueEntry(File, String, String, String), #publishJDFWithFileUrls(File, String)

startTestSessionWithSubmitQueueEntryWithFileUrls

public TestSession startTestSessionWithSubmitQueueEntryWithFileUrls(java.io.File jdfFile,
                                                                    java.lang.String targetUrl,
                                                                    boolean preprocessJdf)
Starts a new test session by resubmitting a JDF file. Any relative URLs in the JDF file will be resolved against the JDF file and replaced with absolute file URLs.

Parameters:
jdfFile - the JDF file to submit
targetUrl - the URL to submit it to
preprocessJdf - if true the JDF file is preprocessed before sent
Returns:
the test session
See Also:
#startTestSessionWithResubmitQueueEntry(File, String, String, String), #publishJDFWithFileUrls(File, String)

startTestSessionWithSubmitQueueEntry

public TestSession startTestSessionWithSubmitQueueEntry(java.io.File jdfFile,
                                                        java.lang.String targetUrl,
                                                        boolean preprocessJdf,
                                                        boolean asMime,
                                                        java.lang.String baseUrl)
Starts a new test session by sending a SubmitQueueEntry JMF message that refers to the specified JDF file. Before submitting the JDF job, the JDF file is published to this TestRunners HTTP server and the resulting http URL is used in the SubmitQueueEntry JMF message.

Parameters:
jdfFile - the JDF file to submit
targetUrl - the URL to submit it to
preprocessJdf - true to preprocess the JDF file before submitting it; false otherwise
asMime - packages the JDF file, its content files, and the SubmitQueueEntry JMF in a MIME package
baseUrl - If the JDF file references any files using relative URLs then these will be resolved against this base URL. null to not resolve any URLs.
Returns:
the test session

startTestSessionWithSubmitQueueEntry

public TestSession startTestSessionWithSubmitQueueEntry(java.io.File jdfFile,
                                                        java.lang.String targetUrl,
                                                        boolean preprocessJdf,
                                                        boolean asMime)
Starts a new test session by sending a SubmitQueueEntry JMF message that refers to the specified JDF file. Before submitting the JDF job, the JDF file is published to this TestRunners HTTP server and the resulting http URL is used in the SubmitQueueEntry JMF message.

Parameters:
jdfFile - the JDF file to submit
targetUrl - the URL to submit it to
preprocessJdf - true to preprocess the JDF file before submitting it; false otherwise
asMime - packages the JDF file, its content files, and the SubmitQueueEntry JMF in a MIME package
Returns:
the test session

startTestSessionWithResubmitQueueEntryWithHttpUrls

public TestSession startTestSessionWithResubmitQueueEntryWithHttpUrls(java.io.File jdfFile,
                                                                      java.lang.String queueEntryId,
                                                                      java.lang.String jobId,
                                                                      java.lang.String targetUrl)

Parameters:
jdfFile - the JDF file to submit
queueEntryId - the queue entry ID of the job to resubmit
jobId - the /JDF/@JobID of the job to resubmit
targetUrl - the URL to submit it to
Returns:
the test session
See Also:
#startTestSessionWithResubmitQueueEntry(File, String, String, String), #publishJDFWithHttpUrls(File, String)

                                                                      java.lang.String jobId,

startTestSessionWithResubmitQueueEntry

public TestSession startTestSessionWithResubmitQueueEntry(java.io.File jdfFile,
                                                          java.lang.String queueEntryId,
                                                          java.lang.String jobId,
                                                          java.lang.String targetUrl,
                                                          java.lang.String baseUrl,
                                                          boolean preprocessJdf,
                                                          boolean asMime)
Starts a new test session by sending a ResubmitQueueEntry JMF message. that refers to the specified JDF file. If asMime is true the JDF file, its content files, and the ResubmitQueueEntry JMF message are bundled in a MIME package. If asMime is false, the JDF job, the JDF file is published to this TestRunners HTTP server and the resulting http URL is used in the ResubmitQueueEntry JMF message. Any relative URLs in the JDF file will be resolved against baseUrl and replaced with an absolute URL, see #publishJDF(File, String, String).

Parameters:
jdfFile - the JDF file to submit
queueEntryId - the queue entry ID of the job to resubmit
jobId - the /JDF/@JobID of the job to resubmit
targetUrl - the URL to submit it to
baseUrl - If the JDF file references any files using relative URLs then these will be resolved against this base URL. null to not resolve and replace any URLs.
preprocessJdf -
asMime - packages the JDF file, its content files, and the SubmitQueueEntry JMF in a MIME package
Returns:
the test session

startTestSessionWithResubmitQueueEntry

public TestSession startTestSessionWithResubmitQueueEntry(java.io.File jdfFile,
                                                          java.lang.String queueEntryId,
                                                          java.lang.String jobId,
                                                          java.lang.String targetUrl,
                                                          boolean preprocessJdf,
                                                          boolean asMime)
Starts a new test session by sending a ResubmitQueueEntry JMF message. that refers to the specified JDF file. If asMime is true the JDF file, its content files, and the ResubmitQueueEntry JMF message are bundled in a MIME package. If asMime is false, the JDF job, the JDF file is published to this TestRunners HTTP server and the resulting http URL is used in the ResubmitQueueEntry JMF message.

Parameters:
jdfFile - the JDF file to submit
queueEntryId - the queue entry ID of the job to resubmit
jobId - the /JDF/@JobID of the job to resubmit
targetUrl - the URL to submit it to
preprocessJdf -
asMime - packages the JDF file, its content files, and the SubmitQueueEntry JMF in a MIME package
Returns:
the test session

Parameters:
jdfFile - the JDF file to publish
Returns:
the published JDF file

serializeTestSuite

public java.lang.String serializeTestSuite(java.lang.String xsltDir,
                                           java.lang.String outputDir)
                                    throws java.io.IOException
Serializes the test suite, all incoming and outgoing messages to a directory and creates an XML-based test report file containing a log of all messages and the test results.

Parameters:
outputDir - the directory to write the test suite to
Returns:
the XML-based test report file
Throws:
java.io.IOException
